titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 1430) to provide for a temporary increase in the public debt limit.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-50, by Mr. Moakley.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1430 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. The bill shall be considered in the House and all points of order against the bill and against its consideration are waived. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments. Upon passage by the House, H.R. 1430 shall be considered to constitute reconciliation legislation pursuant to section 7(a) of the conference report to accompany the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 64) setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for the fiscal years 1994, 1995, 1996, 1997, and 1998.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 26.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 244 - 168 (Roll no. 130).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 242 - 170 (Roll no. 131).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/31/1993--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 1430 (temporary increase in the public debt limit).
